templates.name: When does the drink expire?
templates.content: The best-by-day (BBD) is at the bottom of the can. If it shows expired but has been stored in a cool dry place, there should be no issues consuming it.

templates.name: Are your products certified organic?
templates.content: At this time HOP WTR is not certified organic.

templates.name: What are hops? Are they healthy?
templates.content: Hops are the flowers of the hop plant Humulus lupulus, which in Latin means something like extremely delicious. They are used primarily as a bittering, flavoring, and stability agent in beer, to which, in addition to bitterness, they impart floral, fruity, or citrus flavours and aromas. In a conveniently beautiful twist of fate, studies also show hops can be effective in reducing stress and anxiety. Hops contain flavonoids which have potent antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and anti-bacterial properties. A flavonoid in hops has also been found to help reduce weight gain, lower elevated cholesterol, and reduce high blood sugar.

templates.name: Does your product have calories?
templates.content: No, HOP WTR is a zero-calorie beverage.

templates.name: What am I going to feel when I drink your product?
templates.content: Adaptogens and nootropics feel different for everyone. Most responses range from focused calm energy to uplifting euphoria. Here's why: the ingredients in HOP WTR adapt to your body. So while you may feel an urge to mellow out after a can, a friend may be more inclined to go for a run or start working on their next startup idea. Your unique neurochemistry and hormones - along with sleep quality and stress levels - all have an effect on how adaptogens and nootropics affect you.

templates.name: Is your product packaged in cans with bpa-free liners?
templates.content: All of our cans use BPA-free liners.

templates.name: Can women who are pregnant or breastfeeding drink hop wtr?
templates.content: Out of an abundance of caution, we recommend checking with your doctor first. There haven't been enough studies to show the effects of the functional ingredients in HOP WTR while pregnant or breastfeeding, so we generally suggest consulting with a medical professional about your individual circumstance.

templates.name: What are nootropics and what kind of nootropics do you use?
templates.content: Nootropics are supplements that boost your brain's function by targeting specific neurotransmitters such as serotonin and dopamine. This exotic term derives from the Greek word "noos" (mind) and "tropein," which means "towards." We use a 50mg dose of mood-boosting L-Theanine that is shown to improve memory, decision-making, creativity and overall cognitive performance.

templates.name: Will your products give me a hangover?
templates.content: If by "hangover" you mean brutal headache, dehydration, inexplicable anxiety, and a general desire to shut the shades and stay in bed until the pain is gone, then absolutely not! Our products contain no alcohol and have not been known to cause hangovers. Hangovers are caused by the potent mix of dehydration and your body metabolizing the toxins found in alcohol. HOP WTR contains none of these metabolites, and is also majority water.

templates.name: What kind of hops are in your products?
templates.content: We use Citra, Amarillo, Mosaic, and Azacca hops for a balanced flavor profile of aromatic citrus and crisp bitterness.

templates.name: What is HOP WTR?
templates.content: It's a calorie-free, hop-filled sparkling water crafted with stress-busting adaptogens and nootropics.

templates.name: How does HOP WTR taste? How does it compare to beer?
templates.content: HOP WTR is a fresh, smooth homage to your favorite IPA. The HOP WTR flavor profile is somewhere in between your go to seltzer and favorite craft beer.

templates.name: Are your cans recyclable?
templates.content: Absolutely, our aluminum cans are fully recyclable!

templates.name: Are your products non GMO?
templates.content: Yes! We're proudly Non-GMO Project Verified. We pride ourselves on using the highest-quality ingredients on the market!

templates.name: Are nootropics all natural?
templates.content: Nootropics are not all natural. We use plant-based ingredients whenever possible, like all of our hops and adaptogens. In order to create a healthy beverage that also delivers a real feeling, we found that combining natural and synthetic ingredients produced optimal effects. All of the ingredients are of the purest potency and highest quality we could find.

templates.name: What are adaptogens and what kind of adaptogens do you use?
templates.content: Adaptogens are herbs and minerals that help manage stress and cortisol levels. We craft HOP WTR with ashwagandha to support your ability to destress and unwind.

templates.name: Does (product) have gluten?
templates.content: All of our products are actually gluten free.

templates.name: How is HOP WTR produced?
templates.content: I'm afraid we can't share details on the production process as it's proprietary, apologies for the inconvenience!
